Key Arguments: The proposal is seen as a risk to democracy and an abuse of its principles.
Definitions of misinformation and disinformation in the bill are vague and open to interpretation, potentially leading to misuse.
There is a lack of safeguards against mistaking misinformation for proper information and against broad misinterpretation and abuse.
The bill could lead to arbitrary decisions by authorities without valid scientific evidence.
The legislation may breach human rights, specifically freedom of speech as per the UN Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
The focus should be on education and awareness rather than overregulation.
Notable Quotes: The pace the people are losing their common sense is frightening.
Freedom of speech is the fundamental right and strength of a healthy democratic society.
It is simply not possible to turn all shades of gray into black and white.
